condition.saying: I sense another card shark at the table. Name's Faye, what's yours cowboy?

case.state: Well now, the name's Twisted Fate. It's a pleasure to meet you, Miss Faye. Based on your words, you're no stranger to the table. Here's hoping for a fun game of poker, then.
An outdoor bar, eh? How bout this? All losers owe the winner a drink each at the end.
Well now, can't say I've seen a bar themed quite like this before.
I've never really been one for the beach... Too much water.
Why does the game have to be so close to the sea? Can't we just move further away from the shoreline?
Ain't much of a familiar sight for me here. Never really got true schoolin' in my childhood.
Ain't it a bit odd to be playin' strip poker in a school? I may be a criminal but this still feels off.
Ain't this the most beautiful time of the year?
Sometimes such a romantic season makes ya wanna just dance to your emotions, ya'know?
Poker? Why, I'm always up for a round or two.
I suppose I could play a game or two.
So, what are we playin'? Texas hold 'em? Razz? Maybe even Stud?
A... car... How is it... Nevermind...
Well now, The elite Garen Crownguard even tells stories of me? Ain't that quite the feat!
Ya'know... I've seen plenty and I mean plenty of creatures in my life. A talking butterfly though? That's new.
Just a group of stragglers, huh? Oh well, just a faster win I reckon.
C'mon now the more, the merrier. Why ya' gotta limit us?
Five Card Draw? Eh. Pretty basic, don'tcha think?
Though, no matter how beautiful the season is, Nothin' is more beautiful than the sight of you, ~player~.
You know, ~player~, I'm quite trained in the dance of love. Why don't I show you later tonight?
Deal me in.
Quite the odd bunch o' players. Always makes it more interestin'.
Don't go runnin' home cryin' when I walk away with all your clothes.
You... either know way too much about poker, or don't know jack shit 'bout it. I'm leanin' towards the latter or the two.
I think ~cards.text~'ll do.
~Cards.text~.
Pass me ~cards.text~, Dealer.
Dealer, give me ~cards.text~.
Deal me ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~. And don't go thinkin' you can trick me with a stacked deck.
When I can't decide, I let Lady Luck guide me.
I feel like ~cards.text~ will work just fine.
Just ~cards.text~'ll do.
I'm thinkin' ~cards.text~ sounds good.
Lookin' like it'll be ~cards.text~, this round.
Lady Luck is smilin'.
No sense in bluffing with this lot I reckon. No offense.
Now Dealer, there's no need to rig this in my favor.
Your faces are not trained for poker in the slightest. I can read your entire story with one quick glance.
I don't even need "assistance" with a hand like this.
Don't s'pose a little sleight of hand will hurt.
It ain't gamblin' if you can't lose.
This'll do.
Hmm, this should work.
What? You think I'd just give away my hand? Gonna have to try a bit harder than that.
Why I declare, a bit of Sleight of hand never hurt no-one.
(Damn, with a hand like this I could've cashed out big time! Instead I just get a nice view.)

state.text: (As nice as it is to see such a strong hand, all that matters is it's not the worst outta the bunch. Makes it much simpler to win.)

case.state: (Now we're talkin'. Thank you, Lady Luck.)
(Seems Lady Luck is feelin' generous with a hand like this.)
(They can't catch ya' countin' cards if it's practically second nature.)
(Normally even with a hand like this I'd have to be cautious, but this game is laid back enough I needn't worry.)
I hope y'all aren't too attached to your clothin'. Cause one of ya's gonna lose sumthin'.
'Nother day, 'nother hand.
Just the same old same old.
'Nother day, 'nother game.
Now how do y'all expect to win if you keep revealing your hands through those easy-to-read faces?
This'll do.
Can't go gettin' too cocky now.
It ain't gamblin' if you can't lose.
(Certainly ain't a hand that'll confirm a win, but it sure ain't a hand to laugh at.)
(Damn, without the use of bluffing this game almost becomes too simple. Only way I can guarantee a win is with Lady Luck's blessing and some swift hands.)
(As much as I enjoy the more laid back nature of this place, it's hard to relax with the odd crew that seems to populate it.)
(I say, without the thrill of a cash prize this game becomes quite mundane.)
(Even with the simpler rules, I gotta keep watch on everyone. Don't wanna have stories roam that I lost a game of strip poker of all things here...)
Hmm...
Seems Lady Luck ain't happy with me tonight...

state.text: Now don't go thinking you can get away with stackin' the deck, Dealer. Things might get ugly fast.

case.state: Now why would'ja go and do that, Dealer?
Y'all don't seem to be doin' so hot, hm?
Now this is a predicament.
Tch.
I've done better with worse.
Well this ain't too shabby.
(No matter how much I try to bluff a hand like this, I'll likely end up losin' this one...)

state.text: (Well now, Lady Luck must be tryin' to tell me somethin' with this shitty of a hand.)

case.state: (What did I do to piss you off this much, Lady Luck?!)
(Now now, Lady Luck. I get it... you're mad, but lets at least put this aside till the end of this game, okay?)
(So Lady Luck is using a game of strip poker to get back at me for using her blessing so much... harsh.)
(Listen, I understand you want to make sure I remember you're in charge here, Lady Luck, but is now really the time?!)

state.text: Alright, alright, ya got me. There, happy? Everything back to normal.
Lame tricks? There's ya picture, but you watch your tone, or else I'll make sure ya don't see the picture again.

case.state: Alright then, let's see... what's that? I'll be damned, a fine lady with a crush on a just as fine lookin' lady?
Not much action compared to playin' with bets... hold on, where'd that come from? I'll be damned, a fine lady with a crush on a just as fine lookin' lady?
(Distant vulgar language)
(Pure agony filled screams)
(Whizzing of cards being thrown)
(Unmanlike sobbing)
Okay... I've mostly calmed down... mostly...
Miss Fortune?! I'll be damned, that's a name I never thought I'd hear out here...
Might as well introduce myself. Name's Twisted Fate. Y'all can just call me Fate. Or T.F. Whichever works.
Seems I've stumbled upon an easy win. Unless one of y'all is wearin' twenty pairs of socks that is.
I honestly forgot there was even an age limit for that. Back in Bilgewater if ya' want a drink ya' just get a drink, no questions asked.
Personally, I'm quite the fan of a metal band called Pentakill. That singer's voice sounds like it could kill someone with one shout.
I'm pretty sure that's like... some kind of war crime, an that's comin' from a criminal. Yea that's pretty fucked.
Oh that ain't quite what I meant, miss. The ol' rickety town I live in is called Bilgewater. Your description still fits the place though, nastiest place in Runeterra.
Hell yeah, partner! Whiskey for me.
Now we're talkin'. A whiskey will do. Thank you kindly.
Now this is someone you should make your best friend.
I ain't much of a plannin' type a guy myself. I'm more of a go as the waves push type.
Well if it makes it any easier for ya, Miss Hilda, you could follow me home after the game tonight and we can make a reason to not put it back on.
Well I'll be damned! Guess my nose really has given out if I couldn't smell the literal corpse in the room.
Gah! I though the dead fish smell was just stuck in my nose from Bilgewater!

A chance to discover some expensive relic? Can't pass up an offer like that. Actually... last time I tried somethin' like that I was almost murdered, then kidnapped, and almost murdered again... yeah actually I'll pass.
Friendship, hm? Well, I reckon partners should always have each-other's backs. Know each-other's weaknesses and fill in the cracks where it's needed.
Friendship, hm? Well, I reckon a partner should always stick it through 'till the very end and never abandon each-other... I'll never make that mistake again.
Ain't really the kind of side bet Ii was thinkin' of but I'm sure I could work somethin' out with it.

state.text: Well, I reckon my reasonin' ain't too odd. Just a gamblin' man lookin' for a good time.

case.state: Well, I'd assume my reasonin' for bein' here is quite obvious. A smooth talkin' gambler lookin' for a good time. Maybe you could help me with my search, Miss Pyrrha.
Why, The name is what makes my whole character work. The gambler who can twist fate to his will.
No need to get yourself worked up over it, ma'am. Guys can be civil when it comes time.
Three words. Roasted Scuttle Crab. Crack open the shell and that fresh Scuttle Crab meat just melts in your mouth. One of the finest cuisines in Bilgewater.
Hey uh... Dust was it? How do you think that little critter tastes? Cause based on what I just heard him say, he ain't worth much more than a good eatin'.
I oughta split you in half for insultin' a... man's? hat.
Man oh man do I have some stories.. For instance, just about got sent into the deep sea tethered to a cannon by the biggest pirate in town. All for a gem encrusted dagger.
Just 'bout got captured and fed to some deep sea abominations by this old sea hag one day over some fake sea crown thing. Got the money for it nonetheless.

This doesn't quite answer your question, but my coat costed me a fortune. If it wasn't for the generous donation from a nice old Demacian noble, poor 'ol Fate never would've gotten such a beautiful coat.
What kind of deck? Uh, I reckon, the typical river-folk deck of cards?
I've been needin' a personal shoe-shiner for a while now. I think I'll take ya' up that offer.

state.text: As someone who has seen many deceiving tricks. I doubt just asking will work, miss.

case.state: Assassin... You? I guess deception is a strong weapon but it's hard to place you as an assassin in my head. Anyways, the quicker you are, the better.
It ain't really cheatin' if its as plain as day what you're doin'. I'm pretty sure a big ol' portal would give your plan away.
Why, I'd say my top choice would be Pentakill, though a close second would be the idol group, K/DA, believe it or not.
Well now, for actin' all high and mighty, you sure seem to be quite submissive to your lil' ghost missy.
WHAT ARE YOU DOING TO THAT POOR HAT?!
Y-you're damaging your poor hat! What is wrong with you?!
How dare you dare defile a hat like that...
Well now! You tryin' to distract everyone here with those moves? Gotta say it may already be workin'.
Killin' is kinda in the whole "hired man line of work" deal so yea, gotten quite a few kills under my belt. Ain't no amount to laugh at either.
When a heist goes wrong sometimes a few witnesses gotta be silenced, I'm sure you know the whole deal there.
It's all in the cards. Could knock a bird outta the air with one quick flick of the wrists with these babies.
Do I even have to answer that one?
Roasted Scuttle Crab eating competition obviously. Definitely not anything to do with cards.
It's not an odd occurrence for me to go on the prowl for new gamblin' joints, so it was only a matter of time 'till I found this place.
Rumors are always litterin' the streets of Bilgewater, only a matter of time 'till I heard of a new hidden gamblin' Joint.
I'll tell ya what, Jim. Teleportation is a hell of a useful ability when it comes to tricky to spot locations such as the Inventory.
A mowed lawn expects plenty of visitors. Somethin' along those lines.
Ah don't worry yourself too much about it, partner. Could just be an off day.
That may be for the better.
Man. You're just a killjoy aint'cha. What's next, we can't lie?
Oh you have those too? Real pains in the ass aren't they?
Depends what you call a demon, little girl.
All seeing? Likely. Demon? Well... guess that depends who ya' ask.
Alright so imagine a mountain. Give it stubby arms and legs, an eternally angry face, and a grumpy dwarf-like voice? Ya got Malphite, Taken him down in quite a few fights.
Ya mean like giant territorial toads? Got some of those over in Ionia I believe. Ain't the strongest thing in the wo- Wait you sayin' ya' enjoy being eaten by em?
Beat up Graves? Hell, I do that at least twice a week already thanks to his hard-headed self. I'm sure he would gladly return the favor as well.
Nope. Never even touched a card once in my life.
That's for you to find out, little miss.
This is kinda, ya'know my whole shtick? So yea, I've played before
Well if you ever end up visiting Bilgewater, I must recommend the fried Scuttle Crab. That, or if you're a fan of a good drink go to the Freljord for some fresh Graggy Ice.
Oh boy, here comes the goody two shoes act. It ain't my fault some folk are gullible enough to practically pay me to trick 'em.
Now now, don't get too worked up over it. Most the people never know they were even conned! So in the end no-one is hurt.
Smokers, huh? An old acquaintance of mine had to stop smoking for a period. Should of seen how uncomfortable he was, it was a riot.
Ah. Rough subject there, partner.Let's just say I wish I could go back and slap younger me around a bit to teach him a lesson.
Well, as someone who made a stupid mistake in the past and landed a partner in the slammer, yea, I'd forgive someone for a mistake 'cause I've made some myself.
Inner most desire, hm? Gettin' a bit personal don'tcha think? I can't say I got much of one. I mostly just go with the flow, ya' know?
Well now, if you have a lot of problems maybe you and I could work out a lil' deal that could benefit the both of us.
If luck isn't your forte, maybe we could work something out between the two of us. A bit of help for the both of us.

state.text: Ah I see, ya' got some bodyguards with you on your journeys. Smart thinkin', but that always causes more of a payout split, which ain't exactly my kinda thing.

case.state: Your daughter should come back soon ma'am, I'm certain. I know if I had the option to go back to me family, I would. But that option is long gone...
Yeah, the second he was able to get his hands on that cigar again he was stuck to that thing like a Zaunite to a Hextech Crystal.
Hoo boy, let's see. Well a while back there was quite a nice soundin' bounty my old gang wanted to take up, we shoulda known it was a bit too good to be true but we were blinded with money.
Well now, I could easily say any lie I told was "for their own benefit" if that's all it takes to be honorable like you claim to be, Miko.
Buddhist, nun, and woman. Sorry there, Miko, but that's three strikes and you're out. Captain Gangplank ain't none of those.
Oh really now? Hmm, Why don't we get to know each other a bit more then, Miko?
Well, you lost me at whatever a sutra is but regained me at relic. Please continue.
Man, do I really give off that feel that bad? I'm not just a complete horn dog ya'know? I was gonna offer to help with your whole luck dilemma in return for your services as a bodyguard. Jeesh.
No... It's... Have you really never heard that saying? It's not literal ya'know, Lil' Missy?
I-... I'm startin' to wish Gangplank killed me so I never had to imagine him having a... Miss Saki, why must you put these images in my head?
Slayer of witches, hm? Well I gotta ask then what would you classify the difference between a witch and a mage is?

Seems our relic huntin' goals are slightly different from each others. You see, I'm more of the hired relic hunter for the more unsavory folk, ya' know, the middle men who pay me so he can sell it later. That or make his own use of it.

condition.saying: Whats wrong, Fate? Scared you might lose this round?

case.state: Scared and Twisted Fate are two things that shall never be put in the same sentence. Got it?
Sorry, darlin', but I'm never in a situation where I would be scared when I've got cards in my hands.
Darn, I figured you were one of those "rough and tough, beat the shit out of you for lookin' at me wrong" type of girls.

More info on Cap'n Gangplank? Well let's see. Last we knew before he supposedly died his ship was blown to smithereens with him on it. Now he's back with some wooden arm and tryin' to kill my partner Graves, my rival Missy Fortune, and myself as well.

condition.saying: Heheh, you sure know how to grease the wheels, don't you? Alright, compadre, consider it a deal... just hope you're ready to go down hard. A country boy never holds back.

case.state: Oh trust me, There will be no holding back on my end either.

state.text: Hate to break it to ya, ma'am, but where I'm from all the legal business ain't too relative. Closest thing to law we got in Bilge is the pirate captains.
As similar as our interests are, there's bound to be some differences in our methods. You see in Bilge, legal and illegal ain't in the dictionary.

case.state: I know a few ladies from Runeterra that have somethin' along those lines. One has some magic instrument while the other just uses her voice and some kind of magic stage.
If you can do sea shanties or jigs, plenty of taverns in Bilgewater are always lookin'. (Mostly 'cause bands in Bilgewater rarely last a week...)
No need to apologize 'bout your passions. Gettin' excited for what you love is a good feelin', embrace it.
(Yikes, rough topic, better not upset lil' miss mage too much) Very well, I won't call him that anymore, I understand bein' misunderstood.
(Yikes, rough topic, better not upset lil' miss mage too much) Very well, I won't call him that anymore, I understand bein' misunderstood.
Why, It's a pleasure to know I was lucky enough to get a front row seat to such a special occasion.
No sense delayin' the inevitable then, it seems.
Why, if you're lookin' for an easy win, I'd recommend placin' your bets on me.
I'd personally feel offended if you're bets weren't placed on me.
Why, it's all in the mouth. First you smooth talk your way into their heart, then into their bed. After that you let your mouth do the work down below.
I feel as if you already know my answer, Miss Angela. Though I wouldn't mind experiencing its fulfilling qualities once again.
Well, I've definitely killed, not for savin' the world or anythin'. Though my partner, Graves, became some kind of sentinel of light thing to kill that edgy King Viego.

Listen here, partner. If shit ever starts headin' back that way, you let me know. Only thing that held me back from stormin' Demacia is that damned anti magic statue they got. Don't got enough intel to know how to avoid it.

Ah, Evelynn was her name. No-one seems to believe the stories but her and I used to have a thing goin' on, since I'm the only man to come out of an encounter with such a violent succubus. Hell, I'd say that's quite the accomplishment.
Why, how would I be cheating if the card was in my hat, Miss? It's just for aesthetic. Don't worry that cute head of yours.
It's by no means an intimidation tactic, Miss. It's simply a style. Same way you have your Gothic look goin' on.

Clothing, facial expressions, and body language are all key in figuring out who someone is. For instance, everything you just said was a lie. I can tell every flirt I've used on you has taken quite the effect. So why not give in to the urges?
There's no magic involved, Miss. I just know all the ins and outs of a deck. I was trained at a young age what all can be done with playing cards.
It's quite odd. I hear talk like that all the time, but never any evidence of me cheatin'. Let's see if you're any different.

condition.saying: Even though you dress like you studied the blade while we were partying, you're a lot cooler than I expected, Fate.

case.state: Why thank you, Mi... Wait, what in the fuck was that first part?!
I'm known for leavin' the ladies stunned after all, Janet. But don't worry about gettin' a closer look. I won't bite. Well without permission, that is.
Why, there's quite a few different games I've taken a likin' to. If I were to choose one I'd say a classic Texas Hold 'em?
What can I say? It's a certain skill of mine. The quantity and quality of women that fall prey to my charm is quickly growing.
Damn, does every place have their resident gun totin' crazy woman?
Just when I thought I finally escaped Miss Fortune with her hand cannons, I bump into another gun-crazed woman.
So do Crazy, gun lover, and woman just go hand-in-hand? Or do I just attract a special breed?
So, Panty. I've got to ask. What's with the name? I mean I've seen plenty of panties but never a livin' one.
Quite the extreme hair style you've got goin' on, Stocking. How long does it take for you to prepare it each morning?
I'll be damned. Quite the fine lookin' outfit you got there, Bobobo! I'd say it's practically on par with my look.
Is that jacket some sort of leather, Bobobo? That ripped design is quite the wonderful lil' touch.
I can't quite figure out the exact feel of that outfit you've got goin' on, Bobobo, but its get quite the strong aura to it.
There's gotta be some kind of style or name to the look you're goin' for, Bobobo. I don't reckon you'd mind sharin'?
Ya'know, I'm not usually one for shades, but somethin' bout the way they look on you, Bobobo, is just astounding.
The style you're rockin' right now Bobobo, is some of the finest clothes I've ever seen. Keep it up.
It feels so good to see someone who takes such care of their clothes! I feel you and I will get along quite well, Bobobo.
They oughta kick you outta this place, Bobobo, uncultured ass...
I figured a place as nice as this would have standards, but seems they let anyone in if that asshole, Bobobo is here.
I oughta beat the shit outta you for what you did to that outfit, Bobobo.
How the hell could you just destroy such fine clothing?! Answer me, damn it!
What kind of cruel, brainless, buffoon would wear such an astonisin' outfit just to shred it to bits?!
I'm gonna rip those damn nose hairs out next time you try some shit similar to what you did with your outfit.
If I see you get near any fine lookin' outfit again, I'll make sure you cant touch 'em.
Well I'll be damned ~player~. Either you're some unknown poker fiend or you've got somethin' up your sleeve. Nonetheless you've earned my respect. But don't go expectin' to win this last hand.
Well then, ~opponent~. Congrats on lastin' so long, but this is the end of the line for ya'.
Well I say, I thought my hair was already reachin' the limit for a guy's max, but seems ~hair~'s got me beat.
Never thought I'd see the day I meet a man with longer hair than myself.
I declare, if you had some fur, ~short~, I would'a mistaken you for one of those lil' Yordle creatures.
So, ~celebrity~, a celebrity huh? Don't s'pose you could finagle me a backstage pass for that K/DA band could'ja? Got a proposition for em.
Nothin' 'gainst ya', ~clown~, but I hate clowns. I learned right quick not to trust em. Damn Shaco...
Gah. Don't tell me the circus is in town. I do not need another knife in my back followed by that damn clown laugh.
You see a lot of unique hair in Runeterra, but I can't help but be entranced by yours, ~hair~.
Ah, more pirates... As long as ya' aren't a captain, you'll be fine with me, ~pirate~. Too many captains already want me dead... don't need another.
So uhh... I've seen quite a few different creatures back around Runeterra, but nothin' of the likes of you. What are you, ~alien~ ?
I can definitely tell that you ain't exactly an average human, ~alien~. Not that that's an uncommon occurrence with me.
I don't suppose someone could barter or gamble their way into a better afterlife, could they, ~angel~?
I don't reckon that whole "gambling your soul with the devil" deal can actually be done, ~demon~?
Hm. You even have the same aura as Evelynn. Succubi weren't much of my thing but I do miss her.
Don'tcha think bringin' a gun to a gamblin' house is a bit overkill, ~gun~?
Now what need would there be to bring a gun to a damn strip poker joint, ~gun~?
What the hell is the point of bringin' such a weapon to this kind of place, ~weapon~?
Now, why in the world would ya need a weapon in a gamblin' house, ~weapon~?
I'm real familiar with Lady Luck, though I ain't too certain who or what she is. I just know her energy is flowing through these cards at all times.
Don't reckon anyone 'ere would be interested in some side bets?
Y'all really need to learn to keep a poker face.
Need some tips, ~player~? Tip numero uno. Ya never shoulda challenged me.
Nothin' like the feeling of a hand full of cards.
Before anyone asks, yes, I can read the future with my cards. No, I'm not doing it right now.
Not much action compared to playin' with bets on the line.
Man this place sure has quite the strange bunch of patrons... 'Bout as diverse as the typical crew in a Bilgewater Tavern.
The energy of this place has such a soothin' nature to it. Almost in an unnatural way...
You know, I can barely remember anything from about 20 minutes before i got here... It's as if this place is hidin' its location.
So, ~Leader~. Might as well come out and tell us what tricks you're usin'. Don't go thinkin' it ain't obvious.
Ya' know, gamblin' has been a part of my life since childhood. It got to the point that a rumor started floatin' around that I was born with an ace up my sleeve.
Anyone here got any tips on dealing with a power-crazy pirate captain back from the dead with a vengeance...? No-one...? Damn.
I reckon this place has got its fair share of stories. Anyone got any to add?
Let's see about livenin' this place up a bit. Anyone here ever go relic huntin'? Y'know, lookin' for some strange usually bogus relic in some deep cave, or somethin' along those lines?
Anyone here ever use your skills for your own benefit? Ya'know, like connin' some people outta their money?
(~Person~... Somethin's tellin' me she's 'boutta hit a streak of bad luck.)
(Well now, based on ~person~'s movements, her hand ain't lookin' too slick.)
Bein' able to play in a nice place like this really takes me back to the River Nomads. We made sure our gamblin' tents were top o' the line.
My ol' folks on the River taught me quite a bit 'bout how much more there is to a deck of cards than we know.
Man, if my partner, Graves, were here right now, I'm certain he'd be beatin' us all now. Dumb luck is a talent of his.
Gah, those damn rumors of the undead shipmate are startin' to get to me. They say he has a list of those who've done 'em wrong... What if I'm on it?
Back in the Slaughter Docks at Bilgewater, we would have all kinds of deep sea monsters waitin' to be chopped up. Horrid sight to see, I tell you what.
I really wish Bilgewater wasn't practically one big dock. I never have been a big fan of the ocean... Never learned how to swim...
You wouldn't really be able to tell from my looks, but Bilgewater is quite the nasty town, filled to the brim with the most degenerate of folk...
As y'all may have guessed, I'm quite the big name in Bilgewater. The rich folk look to me with envy, and the poor folk with admiration.
To this day, there is still only one lady to truly swindle me... Still miss her, that damned seductress.
Ever since that seductress, Evelynn, broke it off with me a while back... I've always seen romance in a different light...
Some days I really miss my ol' River Nomad folk. They taught me everything I know about cards.

state.text: Sometimes, I really do miss Graves' hot-headed comments. It really livens up the place, ya'know?

case.state: Back in Bilgewater, things go much less smoothly than they do here, it seems. Not a lot of compliance 'round them parts.
Livin' in Bilgewater has really taught me how to keep an eye out for any and all danger. 'Lotta shifty folk out there.
I wonder if Graves is thinkin' 'bout me right now.
There's a lot of rumors that go 'round the streets of Bilgewater. For instance, there's talk of that tyrannical Captain Gangplank planning his supposed death a while back.
I still hope to find those damned men that plundered my ol' Nomad tents. Got me exiled from my family because they were sore losers.
Some days, I think back to my ol' swindlin' crew. Only ones of us left is Graves and I... All because one trapped bounty...
(~Person~ seems pretty confident suddenly. May have to make sure I stay ahead of her.)
(I'll be damned, ~person~ may have me beat this round based on her face. Guess I'll have to really suck up to Lady Luck tonight.)
(Hmm, ~person~ seems to have quite a confident aura to her. Better keep an eye on her as the game goes on.)
(No matter how simple the rules are here, still gotta keep a look out on my competition here. Seems ~person~ may have somethin' up her sleeve.)
(~Person~... Somethin's tellin' me he's 'boutta hit a streak of bad luck.)
(Well now, based on ~person~'s movements, his hand ain't lookin' too slick.)
(~Person~ seems pretty confident suddenly. May have to make sure I stay ahead of him.)
(I'll be damned, ~person~ may have me beat this round based on his face. Guess I'll have to really suck up to Lady Luck tonight.)
(Hmm, ~person~ seems to have quite a confident aura to him. Better keep an eye on him as the game goes on.)
(No matter how simple the rules are here, still gotta keep a look out on my competition here. Seems ~person~ may have somethin' up his sleeve.)

state.text: Don't suppose I could convince ya to let a third player join the party? Don't worry, here ya go.
Don't suppose I could convince ya to let a third player join the party? Don't worry, here ya go.
Don't suppose I could convince ya to let a third player join the party? Don't worry, here ya go.
WHAT?! Y'ALL MADE ME LOSE WHILE I WASN'T AT THE TAB- GOD DAMN IT, I'M COMIN'.
Don't suppose I could convince ya to let a third player join the party? Don't worry, here ya go.

case.state: Say, Missy Fortune. Do you happen to be part of a pirate crew of sorts?
Pardon me, Missy Fortune. You don't happen to be a pirate captain now do you?
Well Most the time I'd be inclined to say yes, but the reason is I know a lass back home with the same name. Well that and I sense a strange connection.
You certainly are readin' me like a book, but tonight's a bit different. I know a lass by the same name back home. Not only that, I sense a strange connection here tonight...
I'll be damned... Well I see the similarities now, Fortune. From the looks of my cards, you were a orphan of sorts, correct? Picked up by this Fishbone Gang crew?
Well consider me surprised. We're more similar than I initially thought, Fortune. The cards are tellin' me you were a lone child taken in by this Fishbone Gang, correct?
I'll be holdin' on to my own clothes. Don't need anyone muckin' 'em up.

condition.saying: I have to ask... Luck seems to be your lady, does she not?
Ah... Fate, do you have a particular mistress, or is Luck your lady?

case.state: While Lady Luck and I are quite close, I doubt there's any sort of relationship like that. I'm still a free man lookin' for a lady and a good time.
Lady Luck and I are definitely close, but nothin' like a relationship. More like partners in crime. I'm still just a free man in search of a lady and a good time.

condition.saying: Fate, you're enjoying yourself most thoroughly, aren't you?

case.state: Why of course I am. I'm practically in my natural habitat here. Surrounded by fine lookin' ladies and gents, all with cards in hand.
Any time I have my hands full of cards, I'm havin' a good time. To make it all better, I'm standin' here surrounded by some fine lookin' ladies and gents.
Most certainly, Senko. Though I feel the games missin' a certain hands-on feelin'. Maybe we could fix that.

condition.saying: Besides nice possessions... what other forms of pampering might you wish to indulge in?

case.state: Well let's see now... I've been so tensed up lately I could sure go for a nice and soothin' massage from the hands of a goddess.

condition.saying: How do you imagine I'd look in Bilgewater apparel?
The Birgewater aesthetic is quite a nice change of pace...

case.state: Hmm, I'd say you'd be the best lookin' lady to ever wear a Bilgewater outfit, that's for sure. Though, I'm not sure how long it'd stay on ya if I was near.
I'm sure you'd look quite fine in Bilgewater attire, but personally I think you look best without anything on.

Glad to see my skills are going noticed. I'll be kind though and give ya some tips. Cards are alot more than simple pieces of cardboard. Think of em as a part of your body, and truly read them, and you'll do better than any other.

I'm simply lettin' y'all get a slight head start is all. I'll be kind though and give ya some tips. Cards are alot more than simple pieces of cardboard. Think of em as a part of your body, and truly read them, and you'll do better than any other.
You know, Sucrose. It ain't polite to stare. I can tell somethin's roamin' through that noggin of yours when you gaze at me.
Hey now, Sucrose. It ain't polite to stare. What's roamin' through that noggin of yours when you're starin' at me? Already fallen for me or somethin'?
Wha--- Ya know. I'm more surprised you didn't think a card shark was a literal shark that plays cards...
Now what in th--- In all honesty, I expected you to think a card shark was a literal shark with how you've acted tonight.
I ain't some sideshow performer! I'm THE Twisted Fate! I'm one of the best card players around with the looks to match it!
Damn it, this name is supposed to be a threatening name! Ya'know like one that people only say in whispers in a tavern, afraid that Twisted Fate will show up!
Rollin' blunts? Ma'am, I'm not quite sure what you think of me in that ghostly noggin of yours, but I've never touched any form of blunt.
Well now, seems the rumo- Hold on a second... that voice sounds awfully familiar... Jinx?! Did your antics finally catch up on ya'?!
Reading your fortune, eh? I mean maybe after tonight I could give it a shot. I need a lot of concentration for that, ya'know.
Well now, you seem to catch on quick. I am known to be quite the lady killer 'round Runeterra.
As much of a lady killer as I may be back in Runeterra... I don't seem to have much luck with the succubi as you'd think though.
Well now, didn't expect someone of your likes to pick up on that. Just always gotta keep watch ya'know? Ya never know what'll show up at any moment.
Well I originally was just told there was a good gamblin' den called The Inventory. What I wasn't told was the gamble was our clothes, though I can't complain, quite the good lookin' crew here.
A bot?! I will have you know I am not a bottom in any sense. Tell your "audience" they're wrong!
Sell my sweat? Holy shit! That's genius! Bottle it up and call it Liquid Luck! I'll be rich!
Ah, so I see you are quite the lady of culture, Perona.
Well now, seems I've stumbled upon quite the cultured lady.
Rabat... Rabat... Hmm. Doesn't seem to ring any bells off my head, but if ya know he swindled ya he clearly ain't too good at his job.
Well I sure don't recognize the name. Though if he sounds and looks like me, he must be quite the lady killer.
Well I declare, didn't your family ever teach ya to not judge a book by its covers? Quite a jab in the side to hear that's your first impression of me.
Ain't pullin' your punches tonight it seems. Well, guess I'll just have to prove myself to ya as the game goes on then.
Yeesh. What's with the harsh words lady? I don't reckon' I did somethin' to get on your bad side?
Now now, Missy. No need to throw insult right out the bat! I didn't come here to be treated like a masochist. Not tonight at least.
Well I'll be damned, I didn't know some girls came with a mouth as big as a whales.
Well now, seems you've got quite the set of eyes on ya then. I doubt you'll stand much of a chance against me tonight though.
Gamblin's one of my many skills, Miss Nami. If you'd like, I wouldn't mind showin' ya another one of my many skills later tonight.
Oh trust me, ma'am. Lady Luck will smoothen the sails when the time has come.
Lady Luck knows what to do. She'll soon guide me to a victory in any condition.
Lady Luck will help when the time is due. For now I'm enjoyin' the view.
Well now, someone seems to have a keen eye when it comes to the table! While I appreciate the attempt, I'm afraid it may take more than just stepping up your game to take me down.
My drawl? Well, back in Bilgewater its a big ol' mess of cultures. I'd say my way of speakin' is quite common to pick up back there though.
Abusing Luck? Taken by The Entity? What're you on about, lil' miss? I ain't abusin' Lady Luck, she just enjoys my presence.
What exactly does bein' taken by The Entity entail? I'm sure its nothin' compared to the shit I've seen in The Shadow Isles, damn scary place.
Now now, Ma'am. I'm not the kind to lock some valuable asset behind some glass case. I'm more of the kind to sell it off for some cold hard cash.
Now do tell me, good sir. How do you reckon a card of completely different design could pass for a poker card hm?
Well now, what sane man could deny such a tempting offer from a fine lookin' dame such as yourself?
Now there's an offer I could never pass up, but I will warn you, ma'am: I've been told it's not a smooth ride when I'm involved.
Of course I would celebrate Valentines Day! Its the day of love! When men and women can come together in a loving embrace. It's an important day to any man looking for love.
Stories, hm? Well let's see, there was this time my partner, Graves and I were sent to retrieve this ol' relic called The Abyssal Crown. Some prince was payin' us big bucks for it.
A story? Lemme think here, well not too long ago I was hired to retrieve this expensive dagger from Captain Gangplank, the, at the time, leader of Bilgewater.
Newbie, hm? Well I guess it's only fair I make this bit more even. Don't always go for the best possible hand you can think of. Go for the most likely.
Poker tips? Eh, you won't be much more of a threat if you're new anyways. The highest value cards ain't always your best bet. Keep in mind what the other players could be holdin' in their hand.
Well I didn't always travel a lot, but lately I have been roamin' around Runeterra quite a bit. Whether its for a bounty, or just some big gamblin' house openin' up.
Yea, I guess you could call me a roamin' man. Usually Graves and I are in our hometown of Bilgewater pickin' up bounties and such.
The lucky girl has yet to be decided, thought I'd come here and see if any lucky ladies would like to take a shot with the one and only, Twisted Fate.
Unfortunately, there's yet to be a lucky lady to step up to the plate, but it's most likely due to the pressure of trying to seduce the one and only, Twisted Fate.
Card cowboy? Miss, I don't quite see where you're mind is but I'm closer to a pirate than a cowboy.
I wouldn't call myself a cowboy by any means, miss. I'm just one for lookin' good. Howdy none the less though.
It's as stable as it sounds. Some days you'll be runnin' off with more money than you ever thought you would see in your life, and the next day you lose it in a second.
Ha! A knight? That's comical! The knights I know are all at least two times my size. Wielding swords, and axes bigger than their entire arm. I'm not nearly fit for that life.
You could say that, sure. Not too often the items on the line are our clothes and shame, but nothin' wrong with spicin' up things every now and then.
Well really this kind of clothin' was quite common when I was still with the river folk.
Now now, Miss Angela. No need to pry to deep. I'm quite certain my gamblin' fascination ain't no addiction.
Allies is quite the broad term, but yes, there's quite the odd bunch back in Runeterra. We've got the undead, literal gods, magic children, little furry time bombs, the whole deal.
Not entirely sure who this Toyslinger guy is, but yes, many before have called me The Cardslinger before. Personally, I prefer The Card Master.
I feel like being compared to someone named Toyslinger is some sort of insult, but yes, many before have called me The Cardslinger. Personally, I prefer The Card Master.
Well, of course ya haven't met anyone like me. I'm quite the one of a kind, ya' know. I guess a lot say the outfit is cowboy-like but it's just the clothin' of my ol' folk.
Gamblin' is most definitely my main pastime, so I suppose you could say I'm a professional. Though I only really do card games.
As much as I'm honored by bein' called a professional gambler, I'm afraid horse racin' ain't entirely my deal.
Woah now, don't you go callin' me a damn wizard. Ain't nothin' redeemin' of bein' a wizard. Just books and isolation.
Now now, Miss. I don't know if takin' a fine lady such as yourself through Bilgewater will be the greatest plan. Thugs will be on ya in no time.
Takin' a lady as fine as yourself to a town as nasty as Bilgewater would be a bad plan, Angela. Nasty place with even nastier people.
Well, as any average person, I've of course got my own name. Though that will be a bit of an incentive of sorts for some private time with the two of us, how bout that?
I of course got a normal name under my alias, but that ain't really public knowledge. Now if you an I were to be in a room, alone, then maybe I'll talk.
I'll have you know, Miss Nami, I'm not just a swindler of hearts when it comes card suits.
While the ace of spades may be my callin' card in poker, Miss Nami, the king of hearts is my calling card in bed.
Well It ain't just slight of hand all the time. I got a power of sorts with certain cards of mine. Don't you worry too much though, you can tell when they're imbued with magic. They're quite vibrant.
Why, thank you, Ignatz. I do have quite the magical abilities but the clothin' ain't exactly directly related to my magic. More just for my good looks and unique appeal, ya get it?
My job? Why, I do quite a few things for pay, whether its bounty huntin', relic searchin', or gamblin'.
Why, I've got a few types of jobs per say, for instance sometimes I'll go bounty huntin', relic findin', or gamblin'.
Well then, it seems my name truly has spread quite far, That's quite the good news. Why do you ask, Missy?
The one and only, Missy. Seems my name has truly spread as I had hoped. Quite the relievin' feelin'.
Why, this temple of a body was mostly from bein' constantly on the run. Swimmin' is on the no-go for me, though. No way, no how you'll ever see me in the sea...
Glad to know where you're eyes are focusin'. Though this body is mostly from bein' on the run, you'll never see me in the water by choice...
I feel as if I am legally not allowed to answer such a question. So I'll let ya think on that one yourself for a bit.

Why, your intuition ain't far off, There's been many in my past, but only two really stuck with me. One bein' an old relationship with a literal demon, other one bein' up in the air with my partner in crime. Which piques your fancy more?
I'm assumin' you're implyin' the brightly colored cards, no? They're basically my Swiss army knife of magic, if ya understand what I'm sayin'.
You say that as if there was any goal of hidin' it. Back in Bilgewater people want to challenge me simply for the fact they want to beat the best card shark out there.
Why, you're intuition is quite spot on, ma'am. Poker is quite a common hobby of mine, though if you'd like we could play a couple one on one games to teach ya.
Why, your intuition is quite spot on, ma'am. Poker is quite a common hobby of mine. If you're feelin' up to it, why not make a challenge out of tonight's game?
Well, you could ask almost anyone from my hometown of Bilgewater and they would tell ya that fate seems to bend and twist to my will. So I'd say it's a fitting title.
Yeah I can control it, though it's more a problem of how long it takes to set it up. Gotta lay out a pattern of cards and all that.
It's most definitely controllable. The bigger issue is its set up time. Can take upwards to 30 minutes some times.
Definitely ain't some place to brag about. Just a grimy and violent port town with a pirate infestation. Oh, and a good amount of sea monsters as well.
It's not some great and stellar place, trust me. Just a rickety ol' port town with a pirate infestation. Oh and the wide variety of sea monsters.
Long hair, feisty attitude, big breasts... Yup, I'd say you're more my type, Stocking.
Oh? Did lil' miss look see finally build up the courage to confess? Well if it makes you feel any better I've been eyein' you up and down too all night.
Well now! Lil' miss look see finally is tellin' me how she feels? Don't worry, Sucrose, my eyes have been inspectin' your body just as much.
Hah! Good would be quite the understatement, Miss. Gamblin' may as well have a picture of me in the dictionary.
If I weren't any good at gambling, I would likely not even be here right now. So let's say I'm quite the talented gambler, yeah?
While I'm certainly quite the skilled player, all that professional stuff ain't entirely for me. I guess you could say I'm a mercenary of the poker industry, if you catch my drift.
Poker definitely is one of my strongest talents, but I don't really delve into the pro scene. I'm more of a mercenary of poker if that makes sense.
Trust me, Miss Miki. I've had enough experience and teachin's to have some confidence in my poker skills. Only thing that could get in the way is a fine lookin' gal such as yourself.
Oh, don't worry yourself, Miss Miki. With my experience and teachin's I've a a right to be confident. Only thing that could stop me is a lady as fine as yourself.
I'll be damned, didn't know you could read minds. Yeah, I ain't a big fan. Never learned to swim in a town surrounded by the sea.
Why, I'm glad you noticed, Miss. This clothin' is quite standard among my old river nomads. We used the style to draw in the rich.
You've got quite the eye, Ma'am. My clothin' is the common place back with my ol' River Nomads. We dressed nice to draw in the rich.
Now now, Miss Petra. "Rely" ain't quite the word I'd use. It's more like we have a trade deal of sorts.
"Rely" ain't the word I'd use, Miss. I'd say a trade deal is more what she and I got goin' on.
Trust me, darlin', the man beneath the outfit is just as good lookin', if not better.
Hate to break it to ya, Miss, but this fine work of craftmanship is a one of a kind. It was made back in my old River Nomad crew. We we're quite the sticklers for fashion.
Hate to be the bearer of bad news, Hilda, but this fine piece of apparel is a one of a kind from my days as a River Nomad. We always were quite the sticklers for fashion.
Why, I'm the man of your dreams of course. Twisted Fate at your service, and willing to service you any way you'd like.
Stories, hm? Well I suppose there's the time we got caught in a double double cross of a tyrant pirate cap'n and an angry soon to be cap'n.
I've heard that term thrown at me before but no. I'd say the closest term is a pirate. And I ain't much a' fan of that either
If I met the poor man actually named "Twisted" I think I'd have to put him outta his misery. Just a nickname, Sweetie.
Oh trust me, Kaz. Some of the card tricks I can pull off are more than some simple slight of hand. Ever seen a card detonate?
I ain't too worried about tryin' much tonight anyways. Though if you're lookin' for a challenge, Anatoly, I can provide.
I'm sure the outfit was expensive. If you were to pay for it that is. If you're interested maybe I could find some similar clothin' you're size?
Just felt y'all needed a bit of a head start is all. Don't go gettin' your hopes up now.
Can't win 'em all. Even with Lady luck on your side.
Don't need y'all quittin' just cause I'm too far ahead now.
Don't go gettin' your hopes up now. Just wanted a reason to take this jacket off.
See? Now don't none of y'all go accusing me of cheating.
It starts to get boring when you're too far in the lead, ya'know?
It was starting to get to hot in here anyways. So this works out.
Well, guess ya can't win em all.
Seems my luck was on limited time tonight.
I can just hear Graves shoutin' my ear off. "Where's your luck now?!" or "Lady Luck's seemed to have broken up with ya!"
Son of a bitch, that's the last piece.
Now, how did it turn out like this?
Well ain't that unfortunate.
This ain't right.
Well I'll be damned.
Don't go thinkin' you've won just from one round. Comebacks aren't too uncommon ya'know.
I'll be holdin' on to my own clothes. Don't need anyone mukkin' 'em up.
I can just hear Graves shoutin' my ear off. "Where's your luck now?!" or "Lady Luck's failed ya again!"
Lady Luck must've been on break tonight...
Guess I'm gonna be leadin' by example.
Simply givin' y'all a head start is all. You'll need it.
Oh, for luck's sake...
Hey, Dealer. I reckon you should check the other players for cards up their sleeves. Somethin' ain't right here.
Well, then how 'bout your hometown? You don't happen to be from a port town? Buncha tall buildin's and high bridges? Sea monsters all around?
How 'bout your hometown then? Ya happen to be from an old port town with high up buildin's and bridges with sea monsters all around?
Alright smart ass. No, what I'm saying is I see myself in you. Oh god damn it, don't even say it. I have some, fortune tellin' like abilities and ours seem pretty similar.
I also know what came of them... And you for that matter. See, there's reasons I don't like readin' fortunes and memories. It's quite the invasion of privacy, even for myself.
I've also seen what happened to them... and you for that matter. Never was a fan of readin' memories. Feel's like an invasion of privacy, even for myself.
Don't worry yourself with it, Miss Senko. They'll get torn the instant I'm back home anyways. I'll let'cha know now though, the hat won't be comin' off tonight.
Why, I would never deny some loving affection from a fine lady such as yourself. Though, I must warn ya, I can get quite handsy.
Denyin' such affection from a fine lady like yourself would be a crime. Though, I will warn you, these hands aren't just skilled with cards.
Read me like a book, huh? Yeah, I'm a simple man when it comes down to it. Although, sometimes a hand won't be enough.
Well, why don't you start throwing a bit and make your way over here so I can show you what I have in mind.
Now that you mention it, there is a meal I've had a real hunger for lately, and it's hiding right there, under your apron.
Now that I think about it, it seems the perfect meal is right there under your apron.
Now that you mention it, there is a meal I've had a real hunger for lately, and it's hiding right there, inside your panties.
Now that I think about it, it seems the perfect meal is right here inside your panties.
Now that you mention it, there is a meal I've had a real hunger for lately, and it's teasing me in plain sight, Senko
Now that I think about it, it seems the perfect meal is right here in front of me, Senko.
Why not help me take them off and find out what we can do? I'm sure I'll leave you asking for more.
You've already finished warming up over there, so why not make your way on over and I may just throw the game to give you a round two you'll never forget.
'Course that's all you'd have to say about dying... Well what the hell did ya in then? I know you were quite the pain in the ass to take down on Summoners Rift.

Ended up havin' to go down in some underwater cave where we fought some crazy old sea hag for the thing, She kept sayin' some shit 'bout the sea will claim us. We just ignored her and ran off with the thing.

Turned out the damn thing was a set up by Missy Fortune. My old partner, Graves was tipped off 'bout me bein' there and we got in quite the lil' brawl. Soon 'nuff we got caught by Cap'n Gangplank and got chucked in the sea tied to a canon of sorts.
When someone hears that Twisted Fate is in town, they should think there's a man that can seemingly bend his own and others' fate to his own will. Someone who always seems to be on luck's side!
Why, it's kind of in the name, ain't it? People should see me as the man who seems to have fate bend and twist in my favor.
I'm not sure if I should be thankful or worried about this new development.
Why, isn't that an abrupt offer, though strippin' down in front of a fine lookin' lady such as yourself is no issue to me.
If strippin' is what you need, I can provide. Although, you're still gonna have to put up a little bit of a fight for it.
Well now. Seems we've each got quite a bit of experience where it counts. All the more reason I shouldn't go easy on ya tonight then.
Quite rude to just classify me as a basic swindler ya'know. I'm more dignified than an everyday swindler.
Prize? Ma'am I don't think there's a greater prize tonight than seein' you're body free of your clothin'.
Prize? I'm afraid no prize will amount to the sight of your body later tonight.
Don't go thinkin' it's that easy now to beat me, though. I've gotten quite skilled in multi-taskin'. Lotta seductresses try that same technique on me back in Bilgewater.
Well, I'd say if you ask almost any professional gambler, they'd all tell you luck is their biggest strength. There are ways to wrap Lady Luck around your finger some-times.
Lady Luck is a kind mistress if you please her demands. It's a give and take to make sure my luck is at its greatest.
Well, you wont have to worry much about me gettin' caught in a brawl. I'm more of a man of words than actions, if you catch my drift.
Charm is my middle name, miss. I would never go without letting a fine woman such as yourself know of their beauty.
Hmmm. The way you're talkin' sounds like you've had quite some experience yourself? Consider me interested. Just some casual play with friends or do ya enjoy some time in the gamblin' dens as well?
Heh, Friendly is 'bout as far from correct as you could get. Proud is gettin' close but their pride is placed in all the wrong reasons, I'd say.

Well that was quite rude of him if I say so myself. A man of culture would never throw such a fine woman aside. I mean you've clearly got the smarts and beauty, I'm sure most of your crew would agree, no?

Maybe this Rabat guy and I aren't so alike then. I mean why would he pass up a beauty such as yourself? You've got the brains, beauty, and the brawns I'd assume based on your situation where you're from.

I just appreciate the fashion style is all. For the cards though, I was taught everything there is to a deck of cards at a young age. Reading fortunes, magic tricks, how to make 'em a weapon. The whole deal, you know?
As much as I would enjoy walkin' away with full pockets, it's nice to play a more laid back type of gamble, ya know? No threat of walkin' out broke, so I can just have some fun.

condition.saying: I don't understand how gamblin' men do it, really. I feel like the pressure and stress alone could do 'em in, knowin' the risks.

case.state: If pressure puts ya on death's door then you're not fit for the gamblin' life is all. For me when there ain't no pressure, it starts to get awfully borin'.
PFFT Yeah, no. Detective work ain't my shtick. I'm more like a hired gun type of deal. Take out the unsavory folk for other unsavory folk.
PFFT Yeah, no. Well... I guess you could say I do the dirty work the detectives won't do themselves. Making sure the amount of unsavory folk stays down in Bilgewater.
Wrestl-... Well that's not what I expected from the name... Anyways, I've got too many tricks with my cards to say, fortune tellin', mind readin', teleportin', the whole deal.
I am not any kind of wrestler, nor did I expect someone with that name to be one. I can use my cards for many tricks such as fortune tellin', mind readin', or even teleportin'.
Most likely was for its flashy and stylish looks which pulled in traders and buyers, without 'em our kind would'a been tossed to the side like trash.
Yea, we often dressed very stylish to draw in traders and buyers. If it wasn't for our sales and goods, we would been tossed to the side like trash.

Well it's part of the name. The name Twisted Fate is actually admired by quite some folks in Bilgewater, So I've gotta have a noticeable look too ya know. Also, ya gotta admit, I look damn fine wearin' it.
Definitely some new oddballs in here that even made me do a double take, but you're practically spot on. More of the usual... or I guess unusual.
Why, of course I'd have your back the whole way through there. I just feel its a bit lower than your social status, if ya get what I'm sayin'.
No need to worry yourself, Miss Crownguard, I'm sure you will see no foul play at the table tonight.
Why, I had hoped said cheesy lines could've helped me find a Mrs. Fate at this very moment.
Why, the plan was for said cheesy lines to help me get a Mrs. Fate right at this very moment.
I am a mage, Bobobo, there is a major difference, one is a smooth magic usin' lady killer while the other one is a self isolatin' book readin' shut in.
Can't say I do, can't say I don't. Though I will say that's a pretty weak and easily noticeable way to cheat.
It ain't exactly the normal deal you'd think of, though. It's more along the lines of bringin' out a card's true potential. Whether it's meant to be an explosive, or a teleport scroll of sorts.
I must say though, you talk as if, where you're from, magic is not nearly as free as I've known it to be. Hell, I even know of a little girl pyromancer with a hell of a temper tantrum.

Ah, figures that'd be the winner. Graves and I have known each other for quite some time. Used to have a whole crew but after a rigged gig and Graves capture, I was the only one left after tryin' to break him out.
My reasonin' for bein' here? Simply put, I'm here for some fun gamblin' with some fine lookin' ladies and gents. Card games are an expertise of mine.
It's pretty simple actually. I'm just here to have some fun gamblin' with some fine lookin' ladies and gents. Card games is quite an area of expertise for me.
I'll be damned, you'd think I'd be that egotistical? Bit hurtful, but no, the real reason is the closest thing to a lover of mine is off in some big battle. He's been away for a while.
Is my ego really big enough you took that seriously? Damn. In actuality, the closest thing to my lover is currently stuck in quite the important fight. Been gone for a while now.
I certainly ain't the greatest guy in the world but I'd say I'm far from a douchebag. Just a roamin' gambler from Bilgewater.
Even if I ain't the greatest guy in the world, I surely ain't a douchebag. I'm just a roamin' gambler from the ol' town of Bilgewater.
I simply ain't one to insult a woman much. I'm not really here to get in any fights anyways. Came here for a break from all the fightin' goin' on at home.
Insultin' a woman ain't exactly my cup of tea anyways, Miss. I'm mostly just here to get away from the fightin' goin' on at home for a bit, not to make new ones.
Oh don't you worry. I'll get a fair view. Know this though, I've never lost a fair game.
Devil what now?. So what if I can't swim? It ain't a neccessary skill anyways.
You go runnin' your mouth too much and I'll shove whatever a devil fruit is somewhere you won't like.
While that wasn't exactly what I was tryin' to convey, that is true. These cards have taken down quite a few folks before.
Well now, if I'm not mistaken it sounds as if you already had some plans for a private lil' after party? I thought you were a slow approachin' type of gal.
That was an awfully fast response. I don't s'pose you were already plannin' on a lil' after party tonight? Here I thought you were the slow approach type of gal.
Very well. Keep in mind though, that if ya need any tips or tricks, I'll be willin' to help ya out. Card games are very important to a man such as myself.
Well the goal is quite simple, just stay in the game longer than the other. We each get to chose our own prizes for winnin'. I'd prefer some intimate fun if I win.
I... Well I misread the mood here pretty bad, huh. To answer you though, let's just say Lady Luck has a soft spot for me and my looks.
Hm... Guess I misunderstood the situation. Anyways, lets just say Lady Luck has a soft spot for this devilishly charming gentleman.
Hmm, tips with gambling? Well I'd say the biggest thing is knowing how to read an expression and keeping your own hidden. The Face is a window to the soul.
Afraid to say if anything it's likely the people of Bilgewater that would be contaminating it if it is as you say. But likely its just the type of people we attract.
Not quite on the dot, Miss. More along the lines of an underground professional. If I were to play in the sights of the public, most would not be the happiest.
Close but no cigar, Miss. Think more on the underground proffesional side. I don't quite match what the higher ups are lookin' for if ya catch my drift.
No response? Alright then, I don't mind some wanderin' eyes. Just let me know if somethin' catches those shinin' amber eyes of yours.
Don't go thinkin' I'm gonna give in on the hat deal. I'd rather lose this game than give it up.
As stylish as this vest is, I honestly couldn't wait to take the damn thing off.
I would wear these things more often if it weren't such a risk to wear in Bilgewater.
For how small these things are compared to my ol' boots, they fit quite nicely.
Can't believe y'all just kept playin' without me... ungrateful bastards...
If you think the hat is comin' off, you're DEAD wrong. This hat holds too many memories to risk losing it.
Keepin' these boots clean in that shithole Bilgewater is almost impossible.
That hot-headed partner of mine, Graves, always would moan and groan about my dedication to my looks.
Seems it's the moment of truth. Will it be the hat or the undergarments?..
I really need to get a new pair of pants here soon. Been tearin' 'round the knees.
As "unnecessarily formal" as these clothes look, it's a pretty common look among most of the river nomads I used to live with.
Ya' know, even a plain white dress shirt like this can make you seem rich in Bilgewater.
While I don't know what this Little Innsmouth place is, it sounds awfully familiar to my hometown, Bilgewater. Seems we've got quite the similar stories to us.
Not quite sure what Little Innsmouth is, nor do I know anything about the fish people you seem to be talking of. Though it seems my hometown, Bilgewater is awfully similar to yours.
Been quite some time since I've used it, but I can prove to ya if ya give me some time to read my cards.
As little as I like to do it, cause it's by no means interestin', I'll read my cards to prove my point to ya.
Watch yourself on the clothing talk, Missy Fortune. That's how ya get on my bad side. Anyways, seems our hometowns are quite similar. I wonder what else is the same between us?
I wouldn't diss the clothing if I were you, Missy Fortune. That's how ya end up on the shit list. Anyways, seems our hometowns are quite similar. I wonder what else is the same between us?
Sorry, ain't normally my style either. I just felt you and I were quite similar. Believe it or not, I've had the same happen to me. Old gang's gone, same as yours.
Trust me, this ain't normal for me. I just knew we had some connection. Turns out I was right. See, my old gang's met the same fate as yours.
Now now, Senko. We don't wanna jump the gun and spoil the grand finale. Though, it's safe to say, I doubt you'll be disappointed.
I know you're quite excited for the show, Senko, but lets wait for a big grand finale, yea?
Those all are nice but how about a soft body to tease, a Kitsune locked at my waist, and a noise canceling room?
Lucky you, Miss Senko, there's a Kitsune shaped opening in front of me with a meal I prepared just for you.
Now now, Miss Senko, be careful what you ask for. The "smooth talk" doesn't stop when I'm on my knees. It just becomes a bit more intimate.

condition.saying: Ohoh~ You could use a lot of care. But let's start with your clothes.

case.state: You know, Senko. I can read your body language, and by the shifting legs and sultry gaze, I can tell my clothes are the least of your worries.
Now now, Miss Senko. I can see thanks to the way you shifting in place and the warm expression, the clothes is the least of your worries.

condition.saying: I'm sure I can find some way to make your losses worthwhile.

case.state: Trust me, Miss Senko. With me, you'll never have a night that isn't worthwhile.

We gave the thing back to the prince and got on our lil' rowboat and got outta there as some big ol' Kracken devoured his ship. Seem's the sea hag really wanted us dead. But hey, we got the money and the crazy prince died, so win-win for me.

Luckily, Graves and I got over our past and worked together to break outta the rope and swim up. There we discovered we were just bait for Missy Fortune to finally take down Gangplank by blowin' his ship to smithereens.
Seem's my looks are still as effective as ever when it comes to charmin' the ladies.
Now, was that so bad, Ma'am? Though, the hat was never comin' off anyways.
A lady smart enough to respect the hat is a lady who deserves a proper show in my books.
Even while I'm in dire straits over here you tell me to put fashion ahead of strategy. I respect that.
As much as I'd love to know you appreciate the hat as much as I do, I'm certain there were some ulterior goals you had in mind.
Eh, You're closer than you were a lil' bit ago at least.
Well, seems the rules are a bit different between our homes then. See if I were to walk around completely naked I'm sure id be in the slammer in an instant.
You tellin' me I should just walk around with it hangin' out? That's how ya get sent to the slammer real fast.
While I'm always glad to show off the goods, I still have a game to win, and a body to see.
Now now, Miss Nami. I'll gladly fight for the view if it comes down to some poker, but don't expect me to go easy with such a view on the line.
Oh trust me, Ma'am, No one could ever see too much of a body such as yours.
More than I deserve you say? I personally think I haven't seen enough, Miss Nami.
Oh trust me, Miss Nami. You wont see any cheating coming from me.
Don't you worry your head to much, Miss Nami. I'm sure you won't see any cheating on my end.
I'll still accept the offer on the table though. A lady who allows let alone encourages some oogling is a rare occurrence.
Superstitious or not, I will always believe that Lady Luck is always on my side.
You can call me what you would like, ma'am. I'll never back out on my beliefs.
If there's some club of gentlemen it sure ain't where I'm from. Let's just say I'm somewhat of an outlier in Bilgewater.
That secret club sure ain't from my home if it does exist. Nothin' but drunkards and brutes out there. So special breed sounds like a pretty accurate description.
Now why the hell would you fight the damn Baron on your own? I don't know of anyone who could do that.
I-... I'm not even gonna ask anything about that. In fact, I'm gonna pretend I never even heard that one...
You tried to part with one of the drakes?! Is there even anything up in that noggin of yours?
Experience is experience none the less partner. How 'bout this then. If you somehow manage to beat me in a game of poker, I'll pay for a trip to one of my local gamblin' dens.
Certainly ain't a tourists top destination on a trip through Runeterra to say the least. But hey, home is home.

Well, yea. I'm sure plenty of people would agree with that statement. Money is what pushes people to work or steal. When you got an easy way to get money, you got an easy path to an easy life and power.
Don't you know sayin' stuff like that only raises interest? I'll hold back for now, but no promises later tonight, Missy.
Oh well now! I wasn't expectin' someone to take up such an offer, let alone one who knows of my expertise.
Then I reckon tonight's mission has changed to wooin' you over with my nimble hands then, Miss Nami.
Well I reckon these nimble hands can show woo you over with some actions tonight then, Miss Nami.
'Course not. What's there to gain from it if there's no money on the line?
Oh no no no. You're over thinkin' this, my friend. A typical playin' card can hold potential. The ol' River Folk taught me how to use it, is all.

Well then, if that ain't the most bullshit I've heard here, I don't know what is. Sounds just like that shitty city of Demacia. Filled with nothin' but anti-mage scum. Magic ain't somethin' that should just be restricted.
WOAH! Hey now, lover ain't exactly the word. There's definitely somethin' goin' on between the two of us, but I don't think its quite love... Yet.
Woah now. I ain't here for none of that. I ain't some wild crook on the loose. Like I said, I only really deal with stuff in Bilgewater. I'm just here for the gamblin'.
Hey now, Miss. No need to make a rash decision. I'm not a wild crook here to cause trouble. I only really deal with trash in Bilgewater. I'm just here for the fun of it.
It makes me quite glad to hear your thoughts on my look, Miss Angela. But do know, there's a much better sight underneath it all.
Now the celebrity status may be in infamy, but I'm sure it all leads to the same path in the end.
And even if the celebrity status is in infamy, I'm sure it leads to the same path a normal celebrity life leads to.
Well then sure sounds like you and I could switch places and almost nothin' would change for the two of us. Maybe we should try that someday.
Seems like you and I come from not so different groups then. Suppose some day we could try swappin' places for a bit and see who's got it worse.
Hot damn... Miss Angela, it's been quite some time since a lady has made me double take with such charmin' words. I s'pose it wouldn't hurt to give ya a tour then.
I'll be damned. It's been quite some time since a lady's charm caught me off guard. I s'pose you've swayed me into givin' ya a tour of my hometown then.
I--- you know what... sure. Whatever you say, Bo.
I suppose that can still be a step in the desired direction then. I'll gladly teach you the ways of a charmer, though I will warn you. It can get rather intimate.
You're fuckin' with me right?! ~player~ came in not even fully covered yet they're still not stripped clean?!
It also wasn't cheap, but that's not the point.
I ain't a man to back out on a commitment.
Damn thing is so tight. Felt like my damn arms were 'boutta fall off.
Someone could easily choke me out with the damn thing. Not in the good way either.
That and they let me move much quicker on my feet.
All because YOU. Blonde afro bastard....
It was the only way for us to really get outsiders' attention. Well... attention other than stones and shouting.
Everywhere you step there's either fish guts or some pirate-thug's blood, sometimes both.
But how's a man s'posed to get with the big wigs lookin' like some random common bilgerat?
I can just hear Graves's witty line after that...
What did I say? The hat is NOT comin' off. But hey, y'all won't complain 'bout a free show would'ja?
It ain't exactly the most cultured of towns to say the least.
You know, ~player~, I'm quite curious which of the ladies here is your type? I'm gonna guess... ~girl~.
Now now, ~player~, If I were you I'd be strippin' somethin' big right 'bout now. Ya don't wanna disappoint the ladies now do you?
If you don't mind some friendly advice, ~player~, I'm sure miss ~girl~ would really appreciate it if ya showed off some goods right 'bout now.
If ya need, ~player~, I'll gladly be your wing man for the night. Trust me I know all the tricks to pull a fine lady into bed for the night.
You know, ~player~, I'm quite curious which of the ladies here is your type? I'm gonna guess... ~girl~.

Don't forget, ~player~. Not only are you tryin' to impress the ladies, but myself included.
Well now, Seem's you're the center of attention now, ~player~. Though to be fair, My eyes haven't left ya once since the beginning.
Well now, ~player~, if I were you I'd show off somethin' good to grab ~guy~'s attention. I know you've been watchin' him.
Now's your chance, ~player~! Take this opportunity to woo over ~guy~! Or is your plan to pull me in a bit closer for the night?

You know, I've gotten pretty good at readin' faces over the years and you're eyes have barely left me once, ~player~. I can't say I haven't done the same to you either though.
If ya impress me now, ~player~, I'll make sure to give you some private magic shows later tonight if you'd like.

state.text: So you talk a lot about your cards and you seem awfully connected to 'em. I suppose you and I are quite alike then. Does that mean ya also know how to feel the energy of a card too ?
Hmm, even with my keen eyes, I can't seem to get a good read on ya Jim. I feel as though you're quite the wild card when it comes to guessin' what you'll do next.
Well now! Talk about fashion sense. That's the most stylish hat I've seen in quite some time! Well, other than mine of course.
I'll be damned, I see there's someone who appreciates a damn fine hat when they see one. Almost as fine lookin' as my own.
I gotta ask, Colt. What's the deal with the shaved chin? Seems you could easily grow quite the magnificent beard like mine if you wanted.
Now why in the world would you not let your beard grow to its full extent? A nice beard wins ya plenty of ladies ya know.
Gotta say, Arash, you've got quite the passive nature to ya. It's as if you'll go with the flow no matter where it leads. I respect that lifestyle.
Suppose you should take off somethin' like your shades? Whatever leaves your outfit the most intact.
It's a shame ya gotta strip anythin' from your outfit, Bobobo. I'm assumin' you'll be strippin' somethin' small then like your shoes or necklace, no?

case.state: I bet you're regrettin' your foolish actions from before now aren'tcha, Bobobo?!
At least you're foolish actions will give me an easier win tonight. Regrettin' your choices now, Bobobo?

state.text: If I heard correctly, you've mentioned somethin' bout bein' from the 1940s? I find that awfully hard to believe when ya barely look a day over 20.
I find it awfully hard to believe that you're from the 1940s. I mean, you hardly look over 20.

case.state: Oh shucks, seems your dense brain put ya in a tight spot, Who ever saw that comin'?
It was only a matter of time with your brainless play style, that you'd be at your last line of defense already.
Now you're outta options, it's highly unlikely that you'd have another pair... right?
There! You've gotta be outta options now! Finally you're at the end of the line! There's no way you'd have another pair... right?
I want to say the same old "Haha now you lose!" schpeal but with my luck you've got some dumb shit like another pair of underwear...
I was about to go in my same old schpeal of how now is when you lose but I'm just gonna take a wild guess and say you've got some stupid shit like a second pair of underwear.
Gotta compliment the style ya got goin', Colt. Ya definitely got me thinkin' how ya'd look in classic Bilgewater or even River Nomad attire.
Can't help but compliment another man with a sense of style, Colt. Though now I'm thinkin' how ya'd look in some Bilgewater attire or even River Nomad attire.
Every man's got an interestin' past to him, so how 'bout you, Jim? What kinda childhood did you have?
So, it's not often ya have two handsome outlaws in the same room, let alone the same table. Whats the story on that for you, then?
So, got anyone you're lookin' to gettin' back to at home, Jim? I'm sure you've got quite a few ladies and gents swarmin' ya with your looks and personality.
Why, it's not often I meet a man in such a form fittin' outfit. Is it the new fashion trend, or is it just a thrillin' experiment?
It's seemin' you and I may have quite a few more similarities than I expected. I mean, you definitely seem to aim to please all the ladies you lay your eyes on, no?
As insensitive as this may sound, have you ever thought of what you'll do if you're plan with the lady doesn't exactly go as you hope?
Say, Anatoly. I see you speakin' to that little critter with you quite a bit. Can you actually speak with 'em, or kinda just assume?
Don't worry yourself too much now, ~name~. Just take it slow.
I reckon things will go in your favor soon, ~name~.
Luck won't always be everyone's forte, my friend.
Don't go thinkin' you'll get away without some losses against the best, partner.
Don't go frettin' too much over any losses, you'll be seein' a lot when against me.
Ya seem to be racin' into the same sinkin' boat as I am.
Now don't be afraid of showin' off a bit. Us guys gotta be proud of our looks, ya'know.
Don't go worryin' 'bout some wandering eyes now.
Couple a' guys showin' off ain't too uncommon back in Bilgewater.
Gimme a reason to enjoy myself.
Now let's get the show rolling.
No need for a good lookin' lad such as yourself to go hidin' his looks now.

state.text: Just think, you somehow beat the one and only Twisted Fate. Now them's some braggin' rights.
Don't go wasting the easy win now that I'm out.
Well don't go losin' now that I got nothin' to gain but the view.
Quite a few guys back at Bilge like to go 'round showin' off their bodies for the ladies, so I've seen a lot roamin' the streets. Let's see if you can top 'em.

case.state: Psst. I can tell you're eye's haven't left ~girl~ for quite some time now, ~player~. I'll help ya get close if ya don't mind a player three tonight.
Gotta say, I think ~girl~ and ~player~ would make quite the cute lil' duo, why not you two give each other some helpin' hands tonight?
Now is the perfect opportunity to woo over miss ~girl~, ~player~! Don't act like you haven't been eyein' her up all night.
You know, ~player~, why not try and woo over miss ~girl~ and then we can get some three person action goin' on tonight?
Would you look at that, ~player~. I think you may be ~guy~'s perfect type. Why not make a move and show him the goods?
I bet you're thinkin' 'bout what a night stuck between ~guy~ and I would be like right now, ~player~. If only I knew the raunchy world of your imagination right now.
I can tell just from your expression, ~player~, that your mind is just a mess of lewd thoughts of ~guy~ and I. You're quite the perverted one aren't you?
If you're lookin' for a wing man to get with ~guy~ right now I could help you if I get an invitation tonight's after party, ~player~.

So, ~player~, tell me, which of the ladies here pique your fancy? My guess is ~girl~
It may just be me, ~player~, but I think ~girl~'s been makin' bedroom eyes at you all night
It's pretty obvious that ~girl~ and ~player~ are already plannin' a private after party tonight. The looks they're sharin' gives it away.
You know, ~player~, If you were lookin' for a fun night, all you had to do was call.
You know, ~player~, the fact we ended up at the same table ain't some coincidence. It was only fate that two good lookin' folk such as ourselves would meet.
It won't bother me no matter what you strip, ~player~. I'll enjoy the view as long as you're the main attraction.
I don't quite see the point of invitin' the rest of tonight's crew when it was obvious we were meant for each other, ~player~.
